Text: Mm...mm...
...sabeth. My lady.
Good morning, Lady Elisabeth.
Good morning, indeed...
My lady wakes without fuss yet again.

I should hope I would after being torn from sleep so
many times. Trying to resist you never ends well.

I have no recollection of doing anything too
outlandish.

Well, the memory of a certain garlicky wake-up is
still very fresh in my mind.
...I'm afraid I have no idea what you mean.
Oh, I'm very sure you do...

At any rate, your breakfast—or perhaps I should say
lunch—is ready.

Thank you. I shall eat once I've washed my face.
A meal handmade by my dear Mary.
Though it is nothing special...

When has any of your cooking ever been anything less
than delicious?

Such sudden words of praise... I am honored. Did you
have a strange dream, my lady?

...It was a nice dream, actually. One of the distant
past, when I was still just the owner of this land.

That is quite... Well, a lot happened in those days,
but overall they were happy ones.

So much time has passed since then... The world has
changed as well.

True, the world is much more convenient than it once
was, although getting accustomed to it all takes some
effort.

My greatest complaint is that the shape of umbrellas
have yet to change even after a thousand years.
Couldn't there be some way to make them lighter, to
free one's hands?

It's not that umbrellas have yet to change so much as
they've already been perfected.
Well, I still think they could be improved...

Let's set aside complaints for the moment and focus
on eating, shall we? Your food will get cold.
Heehee, you have a point.

Hmm, bandits raided a southern village... It would
seem peace and order do not entirely rule the day yet.

Lady Elisabeth, it's bad manners to read the
newspaper while eating.

Oh, I beg your pardon. Information is just so much
more accessible than before that I cannot help
myself.

And to think I spent all morning sweating away
because someone said she wanted to eat my home
cooking.
...This fruit mousse is very tasty.

Don't think you can smooth this over with
compliments...but thank you all the same.

...Ah, Lady Elisabeth! You can't start with your
dessert! Meals must be eaten in the proper order.

Well, light eater that I am, shouldn't I focus on
eating the things I find most appealing? Dear me,
I rule nothing now, yet still get scolded over
etiquette.

You will always be Lady Elisabeth to me, whether you
rule over the land or not.
I-I see... Heehee.
Did I say something amusing?

No, I was merely reminded that no matter how much
change the passage of time seems to bring, there are
some things that will always remain the same.

This again? You are my all, my lady. That is as true
now as it has ever been.

You say the most embarrassing things as if they were
nothing...
I'd say that goes for both of us.
Hmph, and what would you do if I were gone?

I...would think of it if and when such a time ever
came.

Goodness, seems as if I can't go dying first and
leaving you alone, now can I?
Th-That goes without saying!

But...there's no telling what the future holds until
it arrives, so let's put an end to this talk of
unfortunate outcomes.

Besides, there is still a certain place we need to
find... Isn't that right?
Yes. I have not forgotten.

Good. Now, the rest of breakfast awaits. Oh yes,
I acquired a trendy item of late.
A trendy item?

...Behold! Fresh tomato juice! I procured some from
Mitsugoshi via mail order.

M-Mail order?! When you did you become so versed in
modern shopping methods?

Heehee, I'm not living in this modern era for
nothing, you know. I read newspapers and venture out
into the world as well.

This tomato juice greatly reduces my thirst for
blood.

I see you, too, are making efforts to fit into the
present day. Most impressive, my lady.

Every age has its own mode of life. It is my doctrine
to treasure those things that go unchanged while
keeping abreast with those things that do advance.

...But listen to me talking on and on. Once we
finish our morning meal, let's be off.

The Haven we long for is out there... Though we know
not where it lies, we must seek it all the same,
don't you agree?

Yes, and I shall gladly join you. Time is the one
thing we have an endless abundance of, after all.
Heehee, quite right. Thank you as always, Mary.

Thus began another day in Elisabeth and Mary's quest
for a Haven...
